basics.name: Zefang Wang
basics.label: Master's Student in Control Engineering
basics.summary: A Master's student at Zhejiang University focusing on model compression and efficient AI. Research interests include pruning techniques for visual autoregressive models and diffusion models, network quantization, and edge AI optimization.

work.name: ENCODE Lab, Westlake University
work.summary: Advised by Prof. Huan Wang. Focused on iOS mobile model deployment and visual autoregressive model compression.
highlights: Conducted research on iOS model deployment
Developed compression methods for visual autoregressive models

work.name: Zhejiang University
work.summary: Industrial VR Glasses Backend Image Recognition Algorithm Development for Tower Group.
highlights: Built industrial electrical cabinet component dataset for detecting 17 types of electrical components
Implemented electrical cabinet label text recognition using Paddle OCR to verify device label correctness
Deployed algorithms on server with proficiency in Linux and Docker workflows

publications.name: EVAR: Edge Visual Autoregressive Models via Principled Pruning
publications.summary: First author. Proposed a principled OBS-based structured pruning method for visual autoregressive models with progressive scale-aware distillation to address gradient imbalance. Achieved 1.8× speedup with only 10% quality loss on edge devices for single-image generation.

publications.name: OBS-Diff: Accurate Pruning For Diffusion Models in One-Shot
publications.summary: Fourth author. Proposed an OBS-based training-free multi-granularity pruning method for diffusion models with timestep-aware Hessian construction and logarithmically decreasing weights to mitigate error accumulation.

publications.name: An Effective Information Theoretic Framework for Channel Pruning
publications.publisher: IEEE Transactions on Neural Networks and Learning Systems (TNNLS)
publications.summary: Second author. Proposed an information-theoretic framework using entropy and rank fusion for layer-wise pruning rates, with Shapley value-based contribution evaluation as the intra-layer pruning criterion.

publications.name: Network Binarization via Contrastive Deep Supervision
publications.summary: First author. Proposed BNN-CDS, a binary network optimization method based on deep supervision and contrastive learning fusion, with a suitable scaling factor strategy.

projects.name: EVAR: Edge Visual Autoregressive Model Compression
projects.summary: Developed principled pruning methods for visual autoregressive models targeting edge device deployment. Introduced progressive scale-aware distillation to handle gradient imbalance during autoregressive fine-tuning.

projects.name: Industrial Electrical Cabinet Recognition System
projects.summary: Developed an image recognition system for industrial VR glasses to detect and verify electrical cabinet components and labels.
